title: External link doesn't work anymore in Cancer Scout
body:
Hello, in cancer Scout the external links to the database "Protein paint" aren't working anymore, it seems like the webpage has changed something. See e.g. KRAS variant in case F0053035:

https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust087/F0053035/cancer/92bd5915df201b20193413814afb1190?cancer=yes 

OLD link: https://pecan.stjude.cloud/proteinpaint/KRAS - "The page you are looking for does not exist."

NEW link (to the whole gene) https://pecan.stjude.cloud/variants/protein-paint?gene=KRAS

We also used to get the link to the exact variant in the RefSeq transcripts table if there are entries of that variant in the database.

title: Inefficient db queries makes /institutes slow to load
body:
The `/institutes` view in Scout takes several seconds to load which is likely caused by inefficient query design.

To build up the view Scout

1. Query the user collection to get which institutes the logged-in user has access to
2. For each institute query the case collection for all cases belonging to the institute
3. [Iterate over each resulting case to count the number of cases](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/c91a7b7a7317e2778f5cd6fe8b9604c4679c1294/scout/server/blueprints/cases/views.py#L56)

Each query conducted with `store.cases(collaborator=institute_obj["_id"])))` takes roughly 300 ms so the query time glows rapidly as the user has access to more institutes.

**Suggested solutions**

I suggest that we either modify `store.cases` to accept kwargs for data projections so we can use a covered query instead. By using a covered query mongo wouldn't need to read documents from disk which are likely to speed up the query and reduce the amount of data being returned and casted into python types.

Another solution would be to add a collection of aggregated data that are rarely updated. Keeping track of the number of cases per institute could be done when data is added and removed from the database. With this solution, there wouldn't be any need to continuously compute a number that rarely changes every time a user logs in or goes to `/institutes`

title: ClinVar last sub not closing and sort order
body: I just had the experience of the new submission created not closing on successful submission. The seemingly new submission was also sorted as older than the last submitted one on the clinvar submissionS page. I guess this is partly related to #3787, but it seems there are also situations where the close-current-open-and-make-a-new strategy does not work. See https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust002/clinvar_submissions, where 63f8c5bb6484f8d15a5f18b1 was created last, and is actually submitted, while it shows later in the list and still as `open`.

title: View Sanger order without canceling
body:
Hi,

For a variant where Sanger verification has been ordered, if I press the "Sanger pending" button I cannot close the info box without canceling the sanger order. There are three ways to close the info box - "Send Sanger cancel request", "Close", or the little "x" in the top corner. Clicking on either of these cancels the Sanger order. I think in the past "Close" did not send a cancel request? 

I noticed that by clicking outside the info box it closes without canceling Sanger. But I think if there was a more obvious way of just closing the info box, less accidental Sanger verification cancellations would occur.

Thank you!

body:
Hi,

I'm not sure whether this may be a per-institute setting thing, but I'll start with reporting here. I noticed that deleted gene panels are still visible both on the variantS page (see screenshot) and also on the corresponding variant page (under "gene panels"). In this screen shot, all the panels "Utvecklingsstorning", "panelapp-intellectual-disability" and "panelapp-intellectual-disability-v3" were removed since long before this case was loaded into Scout, and none of those panels are visible in the Gene panels dropdown list on the variantS page.

title: Panel version update for fractional values
body: We currently update with an int(1) each version, but if the version in is already a float / semantic version-like tuple we should probably increment the lower fraction instead. The form validation also currently locks to integer increments from previous value; at the very least the user should be able to adjust or round a fractional number if relevant. Thank you @ehre!

title: Fix #3620 - fix adding callers on load
body:
This PR adds a functionality or fixes a bug.

Before: 
![Screenshot 2022-10-06 at 14 35 27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/758570/194314398-ddd5c5dc-918d-4881-98e6-e17f31cb75bb.png)
After:
![Screenshot 2022-10-06 at 14 36 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/758570/194314430-3e45e1da-76c4-4ebc-9752-6e20e3d83000.png)

<details>
<summary>Testing on cg-vm1 server (Clinical Genomics Stockholm)</summary>

**Prepare for testing**
1. Make sure the PR is pushed and available on [Docker Hub](https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/clinicalgenomics/scout-server-stage)
1. Fist book your testing time using the paxa software installed on `hasta`:
 - Log in into hasta: `ssh <USER.NAME>@hasta.scilifelab.se`
 - Activate the staging environment with the command `us` (Use Stage)
 - Run the command `paxa` and follow the instructions. Make sure to specify scout-stage as the resource you request and the server cg-vm1 as server.
1. Log out from the hasta server.
1. `ssh <USER.NAME>@cg-vm1.scilifelab.se`
1. `sudo -iu hiseq.clinical`
1. `ssh localhost`
1. (optional) Find out which scout branch is currently deployed on cg-vm1: `podman ps`
1. Stop the service with current deployed branch: `systemctl --user stop scout.target`
1. Start the scout service with the branch to test: `systemctl --user start scout@<this_branch>`
1. Make sure the branch is deployed: `systemctl --user status scout.target`
1. After testing is done, log out from `cg-vm1` and log in again in the `hasta` server, repeat the `hasta` and `paxa` procedure, which will release the allocated resource (scout-stage) to be used for testing by other users.
</details>


**How to test**:
1. load a case, preferably with both SVs and SNVs with caller details in the vcf (set or FOUND_IN tags).

**Expected outcome**:
The functionality should be working
Take a screenshot and attach or copy/paste the output.

**Review:**
- [x] code approved by CR
- [x] tests executed by DN

title: Typeahead (suggestions when you start typing) HPO and OMIM terms broken on phenomodels
Scout entrypoint /static sets duplicated response headers causing 502 errors
body:
Scout respond with duplicated headers when IGV ask the `/static` entrypoint for a bam file resulting in 502 errors and that tracks are not displayed in IGV.

**Error from NGINX**
`2022/09/09 09:28:20 [warn] 32#32: *4064 upstream sent duplicate header line: "Content-type: application/octet-stream", previous value: "Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8", ignored while reading response header from upstream, client: 10.231.229.34, server: , request: "GET /remote/static?file=%2Faccess%2Fwgs%2Fbam%2F9313-22_dedup.bam HTTP/1.1", upstream: "http://172.22.0.11:5000/remote/static?file=%2Faccess%2Fwgs%2Fbam%2F9313-22_dedup.bam", host: "cmdscout2.lund.skane.se"`
`2022/09/09 09:28:20 [error] 32#32: *4064 upstream sent duplicate header line: "Content-Length: 26", previous value: "Content-Length: 26" while reading response header from upstream, client: 10.231.229.34, server: , request: "GET /remote/static?file=%2Faccess%2Fwgs%2Fbam%2F9313-22_dedup.bam HTTP/1.1", upstream: "http://172.22.0.11:5000/remote/static?file=%2Faccess%2Fwgs%2Fbam%2F9313-22_dedup.bam", host: "cmdscout2.lund.skane.se"`

**Error is caused by** 
Scout just append Content-Type and Content-Length resulting in these headers being duplicated. Link to relevant [code](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/b0ef15f4737d0c801154c1991b52ff5cab4f5c83/scout/server/blueprints/alignviewers/partial.py#L61)

Headers before append statements
```
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 26
```

Headers after
```
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 26
Content-type: application/octet-stream
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Range: bytes 3285-3310/45531713695
Content-Length: 26
```

Why is it missing on the first case page? Bug or related to the specific case/variant?  It seems to work on other cases we have (different variants). 
/Sofie

title: Flask-Login 0.6.2 Will Break Tests
body:
Latest version of Flask-login, release on June 25th (0.6.2) will break our test suite. 0.6.1 works.

Test
```
pytest tests/server/blueprints/alignviewers/test_alignviewers_views.py::test_igv_not_authorized
```

Will not return unauthorised `403`, as expected, but OK `200`. This will cause the test to fail
```
FAILED tests/server/blueprints/alignviewers/test_alignviewers_views.py::test_igv_not_authorized - assert 200 == 403
```


Suggested different approaches to solve this. 
* Freeze flask-login, only
* Freeze all flask associated packages
* Find bug or workaround

title: Missing genes in PanelApp panel
body:
Hello, me again!

I'm experiencing some missing gene's in the [PanelApp](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/) panels loaded into scout. I was testing with scout [v4.54](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/tree/v4.54) and tried again today with your most recent release [v4.56](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/tree/v4.56) (and re-loading the PanelApp panels with `scout -db load panel --panel-app`) and still seem to be experiencing the same thing. Apologies I'm not giving a super tidy reproducible example, just explaining what I've observed. If it's not easily reproduced I'll spend more time creating a reproducible example :)

I checked several panels in the scout user interface, (they're all the most recent versions) here are my observations.

PanelApp panels in scout with all the genes that are found in the green/high confidence list in the PanelApp website:

- [Arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/134/)
- [Atypical haemolytic uraemic syndrome](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/139/)
- [Arthrogryposis](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/258/)
- [Familial hidradenitis suppurativa](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/23/)
- [GI tract tumours](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/254/)
- [Infantile nystagmus](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/246/)
- [Inherited bleeding disorders](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/175/)
- [Inherited ovarian cancer (without breast cancer)](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/143/)
- [Intracerebral calcification disorders](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/315/)
- [Limb girdle muscular dystrophy](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/185/)

PanelApp panels in scout that are missing genes that are found in the green/high confidence list in the PanelApp website:

- [CAKUT](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/234/)
- [Clefting](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/81/)
- [Brain channelopathy](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/90/)
- [Mitochondrial disorders](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/112/)

Genes that that were missing from these panels in scout that were "CNV Loss":

- [17q12 recurrent (RCAD syndrome) region (includes HNF1B) Loss](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/234/region/ISCA-37432-Loss/) (I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [HNF1B](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:11630))
- [22q11.2 recurrent (DGS/VCFS) region (proximal, A-B) (includes TBX1) Loss](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/81/region/ISCA-37433-Loss/) (I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [TBX1](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:11592))
- [22q11.2 recurrent (DGS/VCFS) region (proximal, A-D) (includes TBX1) Loss](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/81/region/ISCA-37446-Loss/) ( I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [TBX1](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:11592))
- [Xp11.23 region (includes MAOA and MAOB) Loss](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/90/region/ISCA-37468-Loss/) (I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [MAOA](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:13243) and [MAOB](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:6834))
- [ISCA-37440-Loss 2p21 region (includes PREPL and SLC3A1) Loss](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/112/region/ISCA-37440-Loss/) (I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [PREPL](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:30228) and [SLC3A1](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:11025))

Genes that that were missing from these panels in scout that were  "CNV Gain":

- [22q11.21 recurrent (Cat eye syndrome) region (includes CECR2) Gain](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/81/region/ISCA-37393-Gain/) (I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [CECR2](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:1840))
- [8p23.1 recurrent region (includes GATA4) Gain](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/81/region/ISCA-37423-Gain/) (I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [GATA4](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:4173))
- [7q36.3 ZRS (SHH cis-regulatory) duplication region (within LMBR1 intron 5) Gain](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/81/region/ISCA-37467-Gain/) (I'm assuming the HGNC symbol is [LMBR1](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:13243))

Genes that that were missing from these panels that were  "STR":

- [ATN1_CAG](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/90/str/ATN1_CAG/) (ATN1 is [in OMIM](https://omim.org/entry/607462) and has an [associated HGNC gene symbol (ATN1)](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:3033))
- [CACNA1A_CAG](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/90/str/CACNA1A_CAG/) (CACNA1A is [in OMIM](https://omim.org/entry/601011) and has an [associated HGNC gene symbol (CACNA1A)](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:1388))
- [CSTB_CCCCGCCCCGCG](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/90/str/CSTB_CCCCGCCCCGCG/) (CSTB is [in OMIM](https://omim.org/entry/601145) and has an [associated HGNC gene symbol (CCSTB)](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:2482))
- [TBP_CAG](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/90/str/TBP_CAG/) (TBP is [in OMIM](https://omim.org/entry/600075) and has an [associated HGNC gene symbol (TBP)](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:11588))

Genes that that were missing from these panels that were other types:

- [C5orf42](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/81/gene/C5orf42/) (C5orf42 is [in OMIM](https://omim.org/entry/614571) and has an [associated HGNC gene symbol (CPLANE1)](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:25801))
- [C12orf65](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/112/gene/C12orf65/) (C12orf65 is [in OMIM](https://www.omim.org/entry/613541?search=c12orf65&highlight=c12orf65) and has an [associated HGNC gene symbol (MTRFR)](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:26784))
- [C19orf70](https://panelapp.genomicsengland.co.uk/panels/112/gene/C19orf70/) (C19orf70 is [in OMIM](https://www.omim.org/entry/616658?search=c19orf70&highlight=c19orf70) and has an [associated HGNC gene symbol (MICOS13)](https://www.genenames.org/data/gene-symbol-report/#!/hgnc_id/HGNC:33702))

22q11.21 recurrent (Cat eye syndrome) region (includes CECR2) Gain, 8p23.1 recurrent region (includes GATA4) Gain and 7q36.3 ZRS (SHH cis-regulatory) duplication region (within LMBR1 intron 5) Gain are present in scout and can be accessed by what I assume are their HGNC symbols. For example:

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-symbol CECR2
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
1840    CECR2   CECR2, KIAA1740
```

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-id 1840
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
1840    CECR2   CECR2, KIAA1740
```

ATN1_CAG, CACNA1A_CAG, CSTB_CCCCGCCCCGCG and TBP_CAG are present in scout and can be accessed by what I assume are their HGNC symbols if you drop everything after the underscore. For example:

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-symbol ATN1_CAG
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
2022-06-16 17:01:03 leviathan scout.commands.view.hgnc[2619765] INFO No results found
```

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-id 3033
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
3033    ATN1    B37, ATN1, D12S755E, DRPLA
```

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-symbol ATN1
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
3033    ATN1    B37, ATN1, D12S755E, DRPLA
```

C5orf42, C12orf65 and C19orf70 are present in scout and can be accessed by the HGNC symbols used by PanelApp, their current HGNC symbols and their HGNC id. For example:

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-symbol C5orf42
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
25801   CPLANE1 JBTS17, CPLANE1, FLJ13231, Hug, C5orf42
```

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-symbol CPLANE1
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
25801   CPLANE1 JBTS17, Hug, CPLANE1, C5orf42, FLJ13231
```

```bash
scout --port 27018 -db test-database view hgnc --hgnc-id 25801
```

My partial output:

```bash
#hgnc_id        hgnc_symbol     aliases
25801   CPLANE1 JBTS17, Hug, CPLANE1, C5orf42, FLJ13231
```

It looks like [this is where scout is mapping the gene's in the PanelApp data to the HGNC symbols](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/main/scout/utils/link.py#L143). My python isn't great so I haven't looked much further into the code. Either way it seems like there are some "edge cases" that this function isn't currently accounting for so they're just getting considered not present in the database and skipped when loading the PanelApp panels. Another thing to note, I didn't see any of these "edge case" genes in the [reduced HGNC dataset that scout uses for the demo database](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/main/scout/demo/resources/hgnc_reduced_set.txt) so these situations might be missed if testing with this reduced dataset.

Hope this is useful, again let me know if you have trouble reproducing this and I'll spend some time creating a reproducible example :)

title: Appearance that no variants returned after filter
body:
Hi all, thanks for the great software!

We've noticed a behaviour in scout whereby if you are a few pages in when looking at variants (ie. not on the first page of variants), and then apply a filter that reduces the number of variants to fewer than is able to fill to the current page, on face value it can appear that no variants were returned.

This behaviour should be reproducible with the demo database provided by scout. For case 643594, looking at "Clincial SNV and INDELs", navigate to page 2 of variants, then apply a filter for CADD score of 20. This returns a page that says "No matching variants" while also saying that "Filter returns 6 / 680 variants". This is remedied by clicking the "First page" button to take you back to the first page of variants where the 6 variants can be viewed. I interpret this to mean I'm still on page 2 after the filter is applied, but there are not enough variants after my filter to fill up 2 pages, hence my page is empty.

![no_variants_returned](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46519743/172526834-a67f5109-aa94-4265-886c-f5c680fbef6e.gif)


Although this is workaroundable by simply clicking to the first page, it caused some confusion with our collaborators at the hospital and I'd argue it would be more logical to return to the first page when a new filter is applied. What are your thoughts?

I'm using [scout version 4.53](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/tree/v4.53)

Let me know if you require any further information or if I can help with testing :)

Leah

title: Parse REVEL_score, prioritise its display over REVEL_rankscore
body:
Compare https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/MIP/issues/1981. We should not display more than one REVEL score value, but indicate with a link/marker/text what kind of value it is. If available, it is assumed the user would rather see the `REVEL_score`, but for old cases, `REVEL_rankscore` is a decent fallback if noted as such. 

For an interim period, we may be scoring with `REVEL_rankscore`, but displaying `REVEL_score`, which should be fine.

But when you see the report it says that it has 32 genes!

title: IARC links is broken
body: Check any TP53 variant

title: Found a possible security concern
body:
Hey there!

I belong to an open source security research community, and a member (@porcupineyhairs) has found an issue, but doesn’t know the best way to disclose it.

If not a hassle, might you kindly add a `SECURITY.md` file with an email, or another contact method? GitHub [recommends](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/getting-started/adding-a-security-policy-to-your-repository) this best practice to ensure security issues are responsibly disclosed, and it would serve as a simple instruction for security researchers in the future.

Thank you for your consideration, and I look forward to hearing from you!

(cc @huntr-helper)

title: Page timeout while trying to load IGV alignments for a cancer case
body: Example: https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust087/F0044719/cancer/66284704a5de993a9407a0781b9a2965

title: Codecov action v.1 got deprecated, switch to v.2
body: https://github.com/codecov/codecov-action#%EF%B8%8F--deprecration-of-v1

title: Fix MARRVEL link
body: The current MARRVEL link on the SNV/INDEL variant page doesn't work on genome build GRCh38, since it sends genomic coordinates that MARRVEL interprets as GRCh37. It seems a fix could be to instead send cDNA coordinates, e.g., http://marrvel.org/human/variant/NM_012160.3:c.541A>G

title: Matching STR causatives dont render well
body:
Matching STR causatives dont render gene symbol on the link on case page. 
![Screenshot 2022-03-09 at 08 26 51](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/758570/157393721-353941d9-5275-4a21-aa7d-60106dab7010.png)

See e.g. `starkoi` and its matching https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust002/F0034789/db16fae4efe25dae5591b2fe6fdd76a1.

title: Mark variant as partial causative doesn't work
body:
try with this one: https://scout-stage.scilifelab.se/cust000/WGS-prep-control-fam13-211129/ab52365c4cfae377cb2aae683e7f122c

Must be some bug introduced by [this old PR of mine](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/pull/3069)

title: Partial causative missing from Causatives view
body: I noticed partial causitives missing from the causatives view when testing the latest main. There was a change to that functionality in the current release candidate, but it looks more like it was there before as well.

title: Multilocus STR gene deep linking does not work
body: I guess that is ARX and HOXA13. The loci on Stripy are to "ARX_1" and "ARX_2" instead of the normal gene symbol. Same in GnomAD. GnomAD is also broken in the sense that if you go to the ARX gene overview, you will find links only to the first of the two loci. It thus seems likely this model will change with time.

title: js code broken on case page
body: To reproduce, try to fill in OMIM diagnosis or HPO terms for a case. This problem is on current master, not in prod!

title: Some(?) genes not uploaded if no phenotype in OMIM
body:
We noticed during panel upload of MitoCarta that four genes were missing from the Scout db. They share the distinction of being present in HGNC since quite some time (and in an archive `hgnc.txt` I happened to have since a few updates back), in OMIM (present in `genemap2.txt`), but lacking a phenotype, so NOT in e.g. `genes_to_penotype.txt`or `phenotype_to_genes.txt` or `mim2genes.txt`. Perhaps we take a shortcut too much somewhere, assuming genes present in OMIM are also in one or more of those?

Gene symbols to test with: PIGBOS1, HTD2, PLSCR3 and SELENOO.

title: MD5 checksum error in IGV in Scout
body:
For [this particular](https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust127/GMSB-UM009SOM/sv/variants/8974c33e6a5ee2d9a62f403289e4a0e8) SV, we get an MD5-checksum error for region chr3:60801943-60842915 . This error appears for Breakpoint 1 only.

![Screen Shot 2022-02-23 at 12 58 49 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26735714/155321090-50614173-635e-42ff-841e-516e12baea55.png)


I downloaded the bam-file and checked above regions locally with IGV on my computer and didn't see this error.
![Screen Shot 2022-02-23 at 1 40 58 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26735714/155321293-22f83ab2-606b-426d-b4d6-e2743809e8e7.png)

After talking to @dnil , this might be related to different human reference genomes used in Balsamic, Scout and MIP.

title: Updated Cyvcf2 Adds MNPs (Multiple Nucleotide Polymorphism) -Will Break Tests
body:
Somewhere between our locked version of Cyvcf2 (<0.10.0) and the latest version, support for MNPs was added. Displayed below is the result of basic content search.

### Newest
```
cyvcf2% grep -c mnp *
__init__.py:0
__main__.py:0
grep: __pycache__: Is a directory
cli.py:0
cyvcf2.c:36
cyvcf2.cpython-39-darwin.so:3
cyvcf2.pxd:0
cyvcf2.pyx:3
helpers.c:0
helpers.h:0
relatedness.h:0
grep: tests: Is a directory
```

### <0.10.0
```
cyvcf2% grep -c mnp *
__init__.py:0
__main__.py:0
grep: __pycache__: Is a directory
cli.py:0
cyvcf2.c:0
cyvcf2.cpython-38-darwin.so:0
cyvcf2.pxd:0
cyvcf2.pyx:0
helpers.c:0
helpers.h:0
relatedness.h:0
grep: tests: Is a directory
```

Running the test suite will eventually break on test `tests/adapter/mongo/test_query.py::test_query_snvs_by_coordinates` when calling the constant `CALLERS` with argument `mnp`. This because `variant.var_type` which previous was set to SNP or SNV will now may be set to MNP. I have come up with two simple solutions, but unsure which one is correct or best approach.

### A. Add Support for MNP
Add support for mnp:s in CALLERS constant. `/constants/__init__.py`. –I am unsure how this should look.

```
CALLERS = {
    "snv": [
        {"id": "gatk", "name": "GATK"},
        {"id": "freebayes", "name": "Freebayes"},
        {"id": "samtools", "name": "SAMtools"},
        {"id": "bcftools", "name": "Bcftools"},
        {"id": "deepvariant", "name": "DeepVariant"},
    ],
    
    "cancer": [
        {"id": "mutect", "name": "MuTect"},
        {"id": "pindel", "name": "Pindel"},
        {"id": "gatk", "name": "GATK"},
        {"id": "freebayes", "name": "Freebayes"},
    ],
    "cancer_sv": [
        {"id": "manta", "name": "Manta"},
        {"id": "gatk", "name": "GATK"},
    ],
    "sv": [
        {"id": "gatk", "name": "GATK"},
        {"id": "cnvnator", "name": "CNVnator"},
        {"id": "delly", "name": "Delly"},
        {"id": "tiddit", "name": "TIDDIT"},
        {"id": "manta", "name": "Manta"},
    ],
    "str": [{"id": "expansionhunter", "name": "ExpansionHunter"}],
}
```

### B. Cast MNP:s to SNPs
To my understanding a MNP is a set of SNVs. Can they be treated as equivalent? In `parser/variant/variant.py` add the following:


```
    if not category:
        category = variant.var_type
        if category == "indel":
            category = "snv"
        if category == "snp":
            category = "snv"
        if category == "mnp":
            category = "snv"
```

title: update gene panel - server error
body:
Hello!

We're attempting to update our gene panels but we keep getting a server error. Any idea when this will work? :) We tried with the sample file and last year's file too, so it shouldn't be a file format issue.

Also, I'm a little confused regarding the required file format. The instructions in https://clinical-genomics.github.io/scout/user-guide/panels/#uploading-a-new-gene-panel-version says to use a tab or semi colon separated file, but when I click on the edit button in https://scout.scilifelab.se/panels a CSV file is requested:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/145539500-6e52ff58-20b3-42a3-baa3-c80da3735dc4.png)

Thank you!

The **express** case ([421701400259fam](https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust004/421701400259fam)) was analysed with [PID](https://scout.scilifelab.se/panels/603f92c9d05a2282ecd74c50) (Primary Immune deficiency) as default panel. This panel contains the genes TAP1 and TAP2, but if you try to filter for variants in these 2 genes it complains:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28093618/144983311-a833535d-9281-4f1f-a4d9-eb48a1de780b.png)

WHY?

title: Improve LDAP authentication support
body:
Scouts support for LDAP authentication is fairly basic and the login documentation contains some minor errors.

It would be nice to describe how to use the authentication variables, LDAP_BIND_USER_DN  and LDAP_BIND_USER_PASSWORD and filtering variables LDAP_USER_DN and LDAP_GROUP_DN.

Also it would be good if we could mirror the function of `LDAP_REQUIRED_GROUP` so you could setup different user groups which has access to different softwares.

**Errors**
- Configuration variable `LDAP_REQUIRED_GROUP` is not supported by [flask-ldap3-login](https://flask-ldap3-login.readthedocs.io/en/0.9.16/configuration.html) flask-ldap3-login
- The documentation say that Scout supports login with username and password which is wrong. Scouts basic auth uses only email.

title: RNA data not visible in Scout
body:
In a meeting with Anders and Henrik today, it became apparent that we're supposed to be able to view RNA data in Scout. But we cannot. Here are three example families where RNA data exist and apparently should be visible for us:
families 52, 14022, 17172

individual ID for the DNA samples: 52-1-2A, 52-1-4A, 52-2-1U, 52-2-2U; 14022-I-1A, 14022-I-2A, 14022-II-1U, 14022-II-2U; 17172-I-1A
DNA from 17172 has been sequenced twice, from blood and from muscle, but the RNA data comes from blood so I'm guessing it will be linked to family 17172 and not 17172-muscle.

Happy bug hunting ;) Thank you!

title: Scout cancer interface problems (partly duplicated)
body:
I'm copying the text from a customer ticket by Emma Tham:

Dear Scout developers,

I have used the new SCOUT layout for the first time today and have a few issues I would like to give you feedback on.

- [x] Only one variant is annotated in the summary and it is not always the relevant variant. We are usually interested in the coding variants. See eg pat KI/Brehmer account 091: 37-DS-a, variant [37]1:g.45805919G→C where the non-coding TESK2 is listed, while the MUTYH variant which is the coding variant is not (and I need to scroll down to find it). 

I suggest that if it is not possible to select the coding one, that all variants are listed in the summary.

- [x] The ClinVar database (which is vital for our interpretation) should be clearly visible in the summary with the classification. See eg [37]3:g.178938934G→A in PIK3CA (same patient as above). This variant is a known pathogenic variant and this information should be clearly visible in the summary (it is now only visible on the first page).

- [x]  I would like to be able to dismiss variants from the first page, The functionality seems to be there, but is not active for some reason. This means that I have to open up each variant in a separate window/tab in order to dismiss it even when I can see from the first page that it is not relevant. 

I hope that these suggestions are possible?!

Thank you in advance,

Best regards

Emma

title: Problems in cancer scout after the last Scout uppdate
body:
Hi, after the last Scout update a few things are not working as they should in Cancer Scout:

- [x]  Links till “matching causatives from other cases” are not working, e.g.
https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust087/F0041371/cancer/504a020f0068b44557720d5c04c4da0e?cancer=yes

- [x] In the variant page, the gene information is not about the gene in which the mutation was found, e.g. CSDE1 - NRAS
https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust087/F0041371/cancer/91bdff58f63b755cb9ac067040311edb?cancer=yes (in the list with variants it was correctly listed as variant in NRAS)

- [x]  Link to COSMIC is not to the correct variant, e.g.:
Example A: https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust087/F0041371/cancer/504a020f0068b44557720d5c04c4da0e?cancer=yes
There are 3 well-described point mutations at this position, but the link does not include the one that was found in this patient even though it is reported in COSMIC (https://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/mutation/overview?id=42635557)

Example B:
https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust087/F0041371/cancer/6a2cb83e3f6bfbda297bb9625b55d58a?cancer=yes
COSMIC link to c.2601C>A instead of C>T --> non-synonymous change which is reported in hematological cases rather than the synonymous aa change that was found in the patient

title: Fix institute settings page crash

This PR prevents institute settings page to crash if `collaborators` key is not set for the given institute in the database.

**Review:**
- [ ] code approved by
- [ ] tests executed by

title: Filtering on genes not in gene panels does not work
body:
Filtering SNVs by genes that are not part of the gene panels associated with a case when it was loaded into scout does not work. This is regardless if the additional genes were added to the dynamic panel in the case view or by searching for them in the "HGNC Symbols/Ids (case sensitive)" box in variants list view.

The bug was introduced in Scout version 4.32.

**To reproduce**
1. Setup scout instance
2. load case 643594
3. goto `/cust000/643594`
4. Add TBX1, POT1, SIRT3, SLC9A3 to the dynamic panel
5. goto `/cust000/643594/variants`
6. click filters > HPO gene list button
7. Ensure that "Test panel" has been deselected form the filters

**Outcome**
 - Only variants located on POT1 and TBX1 genes that are part of the "Test panel" are displayed.
 - Variants, `cust000/643594/e0163bf1348a4e2723148b490f3fc224` and `/cust000/643594/6b3f7cbc1d25fa84bb5cbb190055c728` (rank 1 and 5) are missing from the output

title: Dissmiss from view of SNV variants
body:
You can dismiss variants from the overview of variants that you get for Clinical SNV and Indels, By ticking the box in front of the genename and then choose a reason for dissmissing in the bottom. However, the reason for dissmissal will be annotated wrong. If I choose "no plausible compound", the tag will be "clinical dismiss"
[Dismiss issue.pdf](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/files/6790461/Dismiss.issue.pdf)

title: Spinning "Work Indicator" Keeps on Spinning
body:
The spinning "work indicator" wont disappear. How to trigger the bug:

1. Go to Case page
2. Leave Case page
3. Hit the Back button

title: HPO terms resource is not working
body: `http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/hp.obo` should be replaced with `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/obophenotype/human-phenotype-ontology/master/hp.obo`, as stated here: https://github.com/OBOFoundry/purl.obolibrary.org/blob/master/config/hp.yml

title: Cant add NOTCH2NLC to gene panels
body:
When trying to add the gene "NOTCH2NLC" to a gene panel scout just flashes the warning "HGNC id not found: 53924" despite it being added to the database.

Its caused by scout not passing genome build parameter to `hgnc_gene` which defaults to grch37.

[https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/b8ef1230651275c77541920eab5ec9116c71c35a/scout/server/blueprints/panels/views.py#L138](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/b8ef1230651275c77541920eab5ec9116c71c35a/scout/server/blueprints/panels/views.py#L138)

title: Pinned, dismissed variants don't always get the "dismissed" label
body:
We were looking at case 21156 today, with two pinned variants. Both variants were dismissed but the dismissal only appeared for one of them on the case page:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/121675352-956f7b00-cab3-11eb-868a-e7849f63e565.png)
When looking at the individual variants, the one that says "dismissed" (variant https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust003/21156/bd56e62df1661869fcb8503c98313415) was first pinned and then dismissed:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/121675457-b9cb5780-cab3-11eb-9362-ada97b3335d6.png)
The other variant (https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust003/21156/bced81136f9913d738836f6c72411bfe) is lacking the "dismissed" label. This variant was first dismissed, then pinned:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/121675751-1dee1b80-cab4-11eb-9c0f-1a8dc9c53f72.png)

Here's another example. Two variants have been pinned in case 21150:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/121675201-63f6af80-cab3-11eb-9ea8-021fb8dc338f.png)
Of these, one variant (https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust003/21150/67f05383c00e929b23d4d079aad328ba) has already been dismissed but the label doesn't appear on the case page. This variant was first pinned, then dismissed, so there is no obvious trend.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/121677608-64dd1080-cab6-11eb-8a06-bba66b578fed.png)

title: Research variantS counter doesn't display the expected numbers
body:
For instance this case: https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust003/19247 has recently uploaded research variants.

When you land on the research variantS page you don't get the total number of research variants in the database (it says Filter returns number / NA variants).

When you use the filters on the same page it returns variants and probably the number of the filtered variants is correct, but the total number of research variants, suspiciously enough, corresponds to the amount of clinical variants present in the database for that case.

title: Splice junction tracks take too much time to load and then the page expires
body:
Probably has to do with the fact that the track is not processed in chunks using the index. In fact the tracks are read from the unindexed_remote_static endpoint (https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/c95bde91782c4a602725405820d4aa3712202f78/scout/server/blueprints/alignviewers/templates/alignviewers/igv_sashimi_viewer.html#L82).

Test case: https://scout-stage.scilifelab.se/cust003/14022/e4f6bda7d7150a2c455ee12e6a41e2c9

- [ ] See if it's possible to read it from remote_static, that sends partial data from the file according to the requested range.
- [ ] Since this code has to be touched, remove the annoying dot shown on variant page close to the track button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28093618/118786001-b3213a00-b891-11eb-9456-fbfb51167e70.png)

title: SV variants with same position not loaded
body:
When loading a trio-SV-vcf into scout, we had this situation:

One variant found in parent and child with position chr7:7478750-74813500
and another variant found in the other parent at the same start position chr7:74787501-74810500

Both variants are loaded into the database, but only one is shown in scout. 

Feels like scout should be able to support several variants with the same start position but differentiating end positions. This specific example might not be the most useful, but still displays the issue. This was a variant called in all three individuals that turned out to be an artifact of the gatk-caller. I just imagine if say, manta would make a call at the same position but as a true positive, but have vastly different end position such that it would not overlap 70% with the gatk. 

[bug_report_scout.ped.gz](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/files/6479013/bug_report_scout.ped.gz)
[bug_report_scout.vcf.gz](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/files/6479014/bug_report_scout.vcf.gz)

Why are these variants not coming up when a panel is selected?

title: OMIM information for MED12 is incorrect in hgnc_gene collection
body:
This is a very specific issue. If I had the time I'd investigate it further myself, but I'm not very familiar with these parts of the code base. Hopefully it's not just something wrong on our side! :)

In the `hgnc_gene` collection the gene MED12 (11957) has `phenotypes` and `omim_id` corresponding to a different gene: OPA1 (8140). MED12 appear to have an alias which is `OPA1`, so I suppose that is the reason?

Repro: Go to the MED12 gene page (http://scout_url/genes/11957) and click on the OMIM link. This takes me to the the OMIM page for OPA1 (OMIM-ID: 605290), but expected to come to the page for MED12 (OMIM-ID: 300188)

No idea if other genes are affected.

title: Searching for genes only queries grch37
body:
When searching for a gene in /genes the API only queries grch37.

`genes_to_json` doesnt provide a genome build to `hgnc_genes`
https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/master/scout/server/blueprints/genes/controllers.py#L55

and `hgnc_genes` defaults to grch37
https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/3d327d64c9fab804cc71b9b285cb30d40fdedf07/scout/adapter/mongo/hgnc.py#L105

title: Bad SO term rank for regulatory_region_ablation
body:
It seems like the rank for the SO term `regulatory_region_ablation ` in scout doesn't corresponds with the [SO term severity](https://m.ensembl.org/info/genome/variation/prediction/predicted_data.html).

`regulatory_region_ablation ` has rank 34 but is estimated to have higher severity (moderate) than its neighbors

[SO TERMS](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/fce09756cec34b7cb1ed868d045121bffd445ff6/scout/constants/so_terms.py)

[Assignment of most severe consequence](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/fce09756cec34b7cb1ed868d045121bffd445ff6/scout/parse/variant/gene.py#L90)

title: Repetition of previous cases for causative variant
body:
Hi,

I noticed that the same case is repeated several times in the list of cases harboring a specific causative variant:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/112940327-47421100-912d-11eb-9a8a-1f26ab14dadf.png)

It appears like the variant was marked causative several times in the case:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/112940408-6640a300-912d-11eb-8458-29226738891a.png)

Link to variant in the case where it was marked causative three times:
https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust003/21054/35e7a581c1ff45091f0765199ac998b5

Obviously this is not a big problem, but thank you in advance for fixing it :)

title: Mitochondria contig name hg19 vs hg38
body:
In hg38 genome builds contig name for mitochondria is named chrM/M whereas in hg19 it's named chrMT/MT.

Currently scout does not support the M notation and as such we cannot filter against the contig. 

Would it be possible to support both notations?

title: Default and custom inheritance models are not displayed on a newly created gene panel
body:
They're only available after a user modifies gene by gene.

For instance try to create a new gene panel based on the demo one. Even if one specifies the inheritance models in the text file, they're not visible in the panel's gene list.

If the genes of the panel are edited later, the inheritance models are correctly displayed.

title: PDF Delivery report is truncated
body:
All the coverage qc reports that are delivered to Scout through deliver_report functionality are truncated and data from last column is unreadable. HTML is readable: https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust107/2017-00600-reprep

Reproduce:
1. Select a cancer case with a coverage qc report:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086877/111222636-63499c80-85dc-11eb-97ee-02a3dcdee6d4.png)

2. Select PDF report:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1086877/111222657-6d6b9b00-85dc-11eb-8a05-36219acdc304.png)

title: STR display for Stranger 0.7 broken?
body:
There appears to be an issue displaying/loading ranked variants from Stranger 0.7. Recent uploads show only unranked loci:
https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust002/F0038368/str/variants

title: Normal users shouldn't be able to change loqus settings on institutes settings
body:
I see 2 main issues there:

- Any user can modify the Loqus settings for an institute
- The field accepts any string, so if an unprivileged user writes "blabla" the whole institute tries to connect to a blabla loqus that doesn't exist with either the app crashing of not finding any occurrence for the variant, which are both bad!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28093618/107610392-cb097200-6c41-11eb-9efd-decf1324c436.png)

title: IGV error message + sometimes missing gene track
body:
Every time I open IGV I get an error message:
Cannot read property 'startsWith' of undefined: https://cors-anywhere.herokuapp.com/https://s3-eu-west-1.amazonaws.com/pfigshare-u-files/25777457/GRCh37.variant_call.clinical.pathogenic_or_likely_pathogenic.vcf.gz

I've also noticed that the gene track is missing in IGV in all variants I've checked in case 21012, whereas in cases 21010 and 21013 the gene is sometimes displayed and sometimes not. It appears like there's less variants (but sometimes a few) in the ClinVar track when the gene track is missing.

Case 21012, random exonic variant missing the gene track and showing the error message:

title: Structural variants alignment in IGV shows entire genome
body:
Hi,
When looking at structural variants, I can view the individual breakpoints in IGV but when I click the IGV button to view the entire SV, I get the whole genome (it used to be an overview of the region with the SV including both breakpoints). This is not case-specific and it's been like this for a couple of weeks.
It's obviously not a big issue, but I hope it can be reverted to the previous settings. Thank you!

Case sidebar collapse is also broken

Fortunately is some change introduced in current master after deploying to production.

title: Insertion positioning in IGV is one base off?
body:
I'm looking at an insertion called on position chr5:1221430, but in IGV it looks like it would be on position chr5:1221429. 

Variant https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust003/20017/8b3e8fe403457286663a106909776556
It's the insertion of an A changing the sequence from GTAA to GTAAA:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/97572621-da451680-19e8-11eb-8d6c-0117b6dce8a3.png)

However in IGV it looks like the A would be placed before the T, not after - changing the sequence to GATAA (and abolishing a splice site):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/57791644/97572728-ffd22000-19e8-11eb-8540-cb3052610ffd.png)

Now, this is probably just how things are displayed in IGV as I see the same discrepancy when looking at small insertions in other cases. But can you please (a) reassure me that it's IGV that places the insertion one base upstream and (b) tell me if it can be fixed?

```

I've triggered it while starting the clinVar submission process from a variant of a very old case. It's very easy to fix, change:
`    for gene in pinned_var.get("genes"):` 

to 
`    for gene in pinned_var.get("genes",[]):`

title: Identify positions in transcript with low coverage?
body:
Hi!

We have a WGS case where we are primarily interested in one gene. In the coverage report I can see that only 99.89% of the gene is covered to 10x; 0% of the two transcripts in this gene are covered to 10x. Is there any way I can identify which position(s) are not covered to 10x? A quick manual look in IGV did not identify anything, and I'm wondering for which exons I need to do Sanger :) Is there any way I can get the depth of coverage in numbers for each position? I mean, can I access that from my end?

Sample: 20053
Gene: SLC6A8, HGNC number 11055, region chrX:152953752-152962048

title: ClinVar revstat string change affects clinical filter
body:
The ClinVar revstat strings have silently changed to e.g. "multiple_submitters" from "mult", likely with the new csq clinvar. While this is kind of more informative, the clinical filter relied on these to lift known variants regardless of other filter criteria. Hence some clinically relevant, but unseemly looking variants may have been overlooked in analyses. 

See e.g. https://scout.scilifelab.se/cust002/F0027508-2/35601d0679231f6b35d004d076a1b760

title: HGNC gene mapping in hg38
body:
When using hg38 cases in Scout we have noticed that some genes aren't mapped to the gene symbol. Like this:
![bild](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11991860/74819356-8eda5480-5300-11ea-8040-420880aa6907.png)

It seems it is using the hg19 data to do the ID<->symbol mapping, as it is the default of `hgnc_genes()`, `hgnc_gene()` and `hgnc_id()` functions. And in most places where these functions are used, no build version is given.

My naive solution to this would be to, in all places these functions are used, change for example:

```
hgnc_gene = store.hgnc_gene(xxx)
```
to 
```
genome_build = case_obj.get('genome_build', '37')
hgnc_gene = store.hgnc_gene(xxx, build=genome_build)
```

But I'm not confident this is the right solution. Any input appreciated!

title: Coverage test passes even if coverage goes down
body:
I've noticed that all recent pull requests pass coveralls test and get the green icon regardless of the coverage. Shouldn't the test show the red cross if coverage goes down? 

Suggested tests for the PR fixing this:
1. Remove 2 tests. Expected result--> Coveralls fails because of coverage down (coveralls report published)
1. Reintroduce 1 test. Expected result--> Coveralls fails because of coverage down in comparison with master (coveralls report updated)
1. Reintroduce last test -> Coveralls passes because coverage doesn't change from master. (coveralls report updated).

title: Scout users with more than one account might not see all their institutes
body:
A quick(ish) fix would be to manually copy all the missing institutes from the complete account to the one missing institiutes.

A less quick fix is to modify the adapter.user query to return the user which has most institutes.

The best way to fix this is to go thru all the users in the database, add all institutes to the official user account and remove the extra accounts.

title: Inactive cases not shown

milestone.title: Fixing small issues
milestone.description:
Take all small issues and add here and fix them.

Original due date passed, but this issue was flooded by fixes to the new 4.8 release - which is fine, but needs more time. We will get there!

body:
My understanding from the last Scout user meeting was that inactive cases should always show up after prioritized (if it fits within the number of cases shown) before active and archieved cases, not to miss new inactive cases. 
I just realised that doesn't work. We have asked for a re-run of a case, which has now been placed in inactive. However I can't see the inactive cases unless I change the number of cases shown to 200. 
Also, the re-run case in inactive, has not yet been re-run from what I can tell on the analysis date. should it not move to inactive when the re-run is done, rather than when the re-run has been ordered? Just want to have a simpel way to see if a re-run case is ready. 

/Sofie

title: Stop ignoring 'build' dir when running Pytest
body:
Update pytest.ini to remove 'build' from the ignored test directories.
Previous default setting was:

.*', 'build', 'dist', 'CVS', '_darcs', '{arch}', '*.egg', ’venv'

This PR fixes a bug.

It will start breaking some unit tests that previously were ignored.

This update is needed in every product using the tests/build name structure!

Further reading [https://docs.pytest.org/en/3.0.0/customize.html]


**How to test**:
1. how to install it
Update your repository

    $ git pull

1. how to test it, possibly with real cases/data
Run the pytest

    $ pytest tests

**Expected outcome**:
Pytest will now enter tests/build and execute unit tests. 

**Review:**
- [x] code approved by @moonso 
- [x] tests executed by @moonso 
- [ ] "merge and deploy" approved by

title: Clinsig filter not working if variant has multiple values
body:
If a variant has multiple clinsig values, for instance "Pathogenic/Likely pathogenic", it cannot be found using the CLINSIG-filter.

Multiple clinsig.values are stored in the database as a comma-separated string, like this: "Pathogenic, Likelypathogenic":
https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/e531c3b15769672b0b6ad92e5d75ecd0ac9c5f8a/scout/parse/variant/clnsig.py#L42

When the filter is applied (with Pathogenomic and/or Likely pathogenic checked) it matches the string clinsig.value "Pathogenic, Likely pathogenic" against the list of selected values ["Pathogenic", "Likely pathogenic"], which will not match.

Responsible code:
https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/e531c3b15769672b0b6ad92e5d75ecd0ac9c5f8a/scout/adapter/mongo/query.py#L292-L296

I'd be happy to fix this myself but I would need some input!

My first attempt was to store the values in the database as a list, but that breaks things in other places. Alternatively, I guess one could do some weird regex matching in the mongo query, but that seems suboptimal...

title: List comprehensions produce different types
body:
Hi @northwestwitch ! I found a strange thing in `scout/server/blueprints/cases/controllers.py`.

The function looks like this (cropped)
```python
def case(store, institute_obj, case_obj):
    """Preprocess a single case."""
    case_obj['individual_ids'] = []
    for individual in case_obj['individuals']:
        try:
            sex = int(individual.get('sex', 0))
        except ValueError as err:
            sex = 0
        individual['sex_human'] = SEX_MAP[sex]
        individual['phenotype_human'] = PHENOTYPE_MAP.get(individual['phenotype'])
        case_obj['individual_ids'].append(individual['individual_id'])

    case_obj['assignees'] = [store.user(user_email) for user_email in
                             case_obj.get('assignees', [])]
    suspects = [store.variant(variant_id) or variant_id for variant_id in
                case_obj.get('suspects', [])]
    causatives = [store.variant(variant_id) or variant_id for variant_id in
                  case_obj.get('causatives', [])]
```
When creating `suspects` and `causatives` above it says 
```python
store.variant(variant_id) or variant_id
```
This means that we either get a list with variants (dictionaries) or variant_ids (strings) or a mix of those.
The problem arises later in the code when the result is sent to the function `variants_filter_by_field` in
`scout/server/blueprints/variants/controllers.py`. That one looks like:

```python
def variants_filter_by_field(store, variants, field, case_obj, institute_obj):
    """Given a list of variant objects return only those that have a key specified
      ....
    """
    filtered_variants = []
    # Check if the variants have information if "field"
    for var in variants:
        if var.get(field):
            # Add more details to the variant
            if var['category'] == 'snv':
                var_object = variant(store, institute_obj, case_obj, var['_id'])
            else:
                var_object = sv_variant(store, institute_obj['_id'], case_obj['display_name'], var['_id'])

            filtered_variants.append(var_object['variant'])

    return filtered_variants
```
It loops over `variants` and expects them to be dictionaries since it does `.get`. This fails when the objects are strings.

Could you fix?

body: First search with a long HPO-term generated gene list is ok, but for additional searches one runs into the character limit of the gene symbol field. E.g. HPO term + clinical filter or HPO term + frequency filter fails, though a first browsable HPO term list can be generated.

title: Polyphen missing for most cases?
body: We seem to be missing polyphen calls for most cases. If this is intended, perhaps time to drop that line from the interface, otw time to troubleshoot! VEP, loading, ...?

title: Different coverage report uploaded in scout
body:
When uploading a family in Scout, one can get two different values in the coverage reports on the different level of coverage.

For example if clicking on the "View report" in Scout, the values for the different coverage depth will be shown. If the URL link is copied and pasted in a new tab, all values will change and totally new coverage values will been shown. The same appear for the covered transcripts. See attached files

[Twist50M_lower_cov.pdf](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/files/1848033/Twist50M_lower_cov.pdf)
[Twist50M.pdf](https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/files/1848034/Twist50M.pdf)

The first part of the case file looks like this:

owner: bonkolab

family: '57PGF'
family_name: '57PGF'
samples:
  - analysis_type: wes
    sample_id: 57PGF
    capture_kit: BGI
    father: 0
    mother: 0
    sample_name: 57
    phenotype: affected
    sex: male
    expected_coverage: 30
    bam_file: /home/projects/.../bam_filename.bam
```

What can I do to debug?

Thanks.

title: Missing variants in mtDNA
body: We have decided that all variants in mtDNA should be loaded in Scout in all cases. It has been like that for a while, but now they are not there anymore. One example is 17137 which has only one variant in mtDNA loaded. There are also cases, example 131, which has only variants in coding regions loaded but the ones in non-coding regions are missing.

title: ModuleNotFoundError requires python version 3.6
body:
Now that Scout requires python version 3.6 (since ModuleNotFoundError is new in the line below), I though it might be helpful to write that version requirement on the github frontpage or somewhere else visible.

Perhaps the line below could even have a try-except clause with a hint printed to help people realize that the reason they get an error is that their python is too old - I found realized it relatively quickly, but with a bit of luck (I looked up the Error in the [docs](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#ModuleNotFoundError) and saw that it was new in version 3.6).

https://github.com/Clinical-Genomics/scout/blob/180b9c3f43fb81794e98b2ac1b01464b0cb449bb/scout/commands/base.py#L33

Stacktrace after installing according to front-page:

```

title: Dashboard crashes when zero cases are in the database
body:
The dashboard reporting includes several percent-based statistics that are usually derived be dividing some data set by the number of cases - and if the cases are '0', then the whole thing implodes. Should perhaps be made safe against that sort of issue?

Cheers,
Marc

title: error in load_database.py prevents creation of users in 3.5 (pip)
body:
Hi,
just started trying to use Scout and ran into a small bump. 

My setup: Fresh Install of Ubuntu Xenial in a Singularity Container with a minimal system, Python2.7 and pip 9 and the current stable release of scout from pip. 

When trying to create a user, I got an error saying that the global variable institute_name was not defined; this seems to trace back to line 55 in load_database.py where the method accepts the institute ID from the command line, and then tries to re-assign institute_id=institute_name, which does not exist in this context. 
Changing this to institute_id=institute_id fixes the issue for me. 

Best,
Marc

title: database version not consequential
body:
we have noticed the following in-congruence on the database version reported in scout.
family 15080, uploaded 2015-08-30 version 6.2
familiy 15102, uploaded 2015-09-23 version 6.3
family 15044 uploaded 2015-11-12 8or 17) version 6.2

This could be connected to the previous issued with upload date.
Kenny looked into this and the versions do not correspond correctly...
The version used todat is 6.5
Something to investigate before we upgrade to version 7 of the database :)

Michela
PS same issue as issue#209, but It got closed before I could finish to edit it, so i'm not sure the answer I've got was correct. Sorry to bother you again but it is an important issue!

title: Variants with wrong ExAC frequencies
body:
Hi,

I found cases of wrongly assigned ExAC frequencies. See the screeshot below for two examples.
This will affect filtering. Moreover it would be simpler to have "N/A" or "none" for variants that are not reported in ExAC in order to avoid clicking to the ExAC link.

title: Handle incorrect OMIM phenotype entries
body:
We've had a few issues with weird OMIM phenotype entries lately. The same line is affected in `get_genes.py`. See below.

It might be OK to quit the import but we should be defensive and log a more informative error/exception.

It might also be worth discussing weather we should try to do a rollback and remove already uploaded if the upload fails for some reason?

``` python
import logging
logger = logging.getLogger()

# ...

try:
    phenotype_id = int(splitted_record[
except ValueError:
    logger.warning("Couldn't create phenotype model: %s", gene_annotation)
    continue
```

body:
- [ ] Communicate to users

EDIT: updated goals for "feature"

title: Previous variant fails
body:
For some reason two variants are returned in the query the is supposed to fetch the "previous variant".

So this query for example returns two documents:

``` javascript
db.variant.find({case_id: "cust003_15018", variant_rank: 12})
```

This doesn't make any sense of course - do you know what could've happened? Is it perhaps due to a reload of updated variants?

EDIT: both variants have the same "variant_type"

title: delete case fails on auth...
body:
I recognize this error from before... I don't know if you need to connect with MongoEngine in a special way to get admin access. I'm pretty sure I'm authenticating as an admin user.

``` python
pymongo.errors.OperationFailure: command SON([('listDatabases', 1)]) on namespace admin.$cmd failed: not authorized on admin to execute command { listDatabases: 1 }
```

I don't know what you think about the solution to just handle a non-existent database using "try/catch"? I think it's a little strange that deleting a case should require a superuser/admin - proper authentication to the database in question should be OK, right?

title: Clarify: uploading the same case twice
body:
I just noticed an issue when you upload a case twice. The problem is I've used only the display name to get the case from the database and this is not guaranteed to be unique of course...

Let's see what how we solve this in light of the validation :confused:
